locations.name: Amazon Rainforest
locations.description: The world's largest tropical rainforest, rich in flora and fauna.
locations.protection: Partially protected by national parks and reserves

locations.name: Congo Basin
locations.description: The second-largest rainforest, home to gorillas and forest elephants.
locations.protection: Various conservation programs active

locations.name: Sundaland
locations.description: Southeast Asian hotspot with dense rainforests and endangered species.
locations.protection: Limited; key areas like Borneo have protected zones

locations.name: Himalayas
locations.description: Mountain range with extreme biodiversity and endemic species.
locations.protection: Protected by several national parks and sanctuaries

locations.name: Coral Triangle
locations.description: Marine hotspot with highest diversity of coral reef species.
locations.protection: Marine protected areas and regional efforts

locations.name: Madagascar and the Indian Ocean Islands
locations.description: Isolated ecosystems with 90% species endemism.
locations.protection: Some areas under conservation but enforcement is weak

locations.name: Indo-Burma Region
locations.description: One of the most threatened biodiversity hotspots in Asia.
locations.protection: Fragmented protection through scattered reserves

locations.name: Western Ghats and Sri Lanka
locations.description: High biodiversity with many endemic species of amphibians and plants.
locations.protection: Several UNESCO World Heritage Sites

locations.name: Mesoamerican Forests
locations.description: Stretching from Mexico to Panama, rich in primates and birds.
locations.threats: Deforestation, drug trafficking routes, climate change
locations.protection: Numerous eco-parks and cross-border conservation projects

locations.name: New Guinea Rainforests
locations.description: One of the last untouched rainforests with tribal cultures and unique species.
locations.protection: Traditional land management + some formal protection

locations.name: Borneo
locations.description: Tropical rainforest home to orangutans, pygmy elephants, and rare flora.
locations.protection: Protected zones exist but under pressure

locations.name: Atlantic Forest (Mata Atlântica)
locations.description: Brazilian coastal rainforest with extreme deforestation but high biodiversity.
locations.protection: Small protected areas; active restoration projects

locations.name: New Caledonia
locations.description: Pacific island with ancient species and isolated evolution.
locations.protection: Partially protected; conservation initiatives growing

locations.name: Philippines
locations.description: Archipelago with high biodiversity and over 6,000 endemic species.
locations.protection: Protected areas exist but enforcement is weak

locations.name: Japan
locations.description: Mountainous islands with unique species adapted to all climate zones.
locations.protection: National parks and community forests

locations.name: Caribbean Islands
locations.description: A chain of islands with high species endemism, especially reptiles and plants.
locations.protection: Scattered marine and terrestrial parks

locations.name: Irano-Anatolian Region
locations.description: Highlands and plateaus with diverse endemic flora.
locations.protection: Low; scattered efforts

locations.name: Eastern Afromontane
locations.description: Chain of mountains running from Saudi Arabia to Mozambique, rich in endemic species.
locations.protection: Some national parks and reserves

locations.name: Tumbes-Chocó-Magdalena
locations.description: A moist forest hotspot stretching from Panama to Ecuador.
locations.protection: Fragmented; some key zones protected

locations.name: Wallacea
locations.description: Indonesian region between Asia and Australia, full of endemic wildlife.
locations.protection: Limited marine and forest reserves

locations.name: Mountains of Central Asia
locations.description: Harsh but biodiverse landscapes including deserts, steppes, and alpine zones.
locations.protection: Low protection but increasing conservation interest

locations.name: Chilean Winter Rainfall-Valdivian Forests
locations.description: Temperate forests with ancient tree species and high endemism.
locations.protection: Some parts protected, growing awareness
